DNV is the independent expert in assurance and risk management, operating in more than 100 countries. Through our broad experience and deep expertise, we advance safety and sustainable performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions. Title: Business Transformation Analyst (Intern)
Company: SOCAN - Society of Composers, Authors and Music...
Descriptions:
We’re Hiring!
Business Transformation Analyst (Intern)
www.socan.com

Full-time - Temporary

WHO WE ARE
SOCAN is a not-for-profit copyright collective dedicated to ensuring music creators and publishers receive what they have rightfully earned for the use of their work. SOCAN supports and represents more than 180,000 songwriters, composers, and music publishers. Through licensing, global royalty collection and advocacy, we help creators to keep making the music that entertains, moves, and inspires us

OUR COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY, EQUITY, INCLUSION, AND ANTI-RACISM
SOCAN thrives with a variety of viewpoints, identities, and backgrounds, and we are committed to anti-racism. Everyone is welcome to apply for our wide range of roles, regardless of gender identity, gender expression, ethnicity, race, age, culture, sexual orientation, religious belief, or physical ability. Learn more about SOCAN’s commitment to Inclusion & Anti-Racism.

WHY WORK WITH US?
Make a difference by supporting and collaborating with a vibrant and creative community
Enjoy many options for workplace flexibility and work-life balance
Get involved in the rapidly changing creative space
Advocate for and empower the creative community
Together, we’ll help music creators earn more income and make a living
WHAT WE OFFER

35-hour workweek schedule (possible flexible work options i.e., 4-day work week (position based))
Virtual My Wellness program, including access to SOCAN fitness facility (Only for Toronto based positions)
Inclusive and collaborative working environment
ABOUT THE ROLE

The Business Transformation Analyst will play a key role in supporting leadership in the planning and execution of SOCAN’s business transformation efforts. This will include the documentation and review of current and target state processes, data analysis, project task execution and research activities.

WHAT YOU’LL DO / KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Assist in process mapping initiatives to support the 2023 strategic transformation agenda.
Conduct process optimization/analysis.
Data compilation and analysis to identify high impact opportunities for improvement.
Assist in project documentation for the 2023 strategic transformation agenda.
Project planning and execution tasks
Research projects as required.
WHAT YOU WILL BRING / QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE

Currently enrolled in post secondary education, preferably a Business/Economics program
Experience (school projects or external) in data analysis and interpretation
Available to work 35 hours a week, May through August
Ability to work independently (with direction) and highly self motivated to achieve results
Ability to manage workload effectively including planning, organizing, prioritizing and meeting deadlines
Strong communication (both written and verbal) skills
Experience with the MS suite of tools (Excel, Outlook, Word, and PowerPoint)
Knowledge and interest in working in the Music Industry
ACCESSIBILITY & ACCOMMODATION

SOCAN is committed to providing an inclusive workplace environment that meets the accessibility needs of employees with disabilities. Should you require accommodations please contact us directly at hr@socan.com and we will make the necessary accommodations. Applications submitted to this email address will not be accepted.

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY
SOCAN is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Hiring and other employment decisions at SOCAN are made without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, ancestry, national origin, ethnic origin, age, disability, citizenship, veteran status, sexual orientation, record of offences, marital status, family status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial, or local law, regulation, or ordinance.

If you don’t see yourself fully reflected in every job requirement listed on the posting above, we still encourage you to reach out and apply. Research has shown underrepresented groups often only apply when they feel 100% qualified. We are committed to creating a more equitable, inclusive, and diverse company and we strongly encourage applicants of all genders, ages, ethnicities, cultures, abilities, sexual orientations, and life experiences to apply.

HOW TO APPLY
If you’re interested in joining us, we’d love to hear from you: http://www.socan.com/careers/
Thank you for your interest in our company; we will be in touch with those candidates we wish to interview.
To learn more about SOCAN, go to www.socan.com. You can also follow us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram, and Facebook (@SOCANmusic/@SOCANmusique).

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Descriptions:
Job Title:
Business Systems Analyst
Location:
Toronto, CA
Duration: Long term
Job Description:
This resource will be working on Business Analysis, Demo User Acceptance, Testing and Integration in migrating partners from on-prim applications to off Ramp cloud based supply chain.
Duties performed by this resource will include the following:
Follow Agile methodology for development with iterations of 2 weeks or less
Participate in daily standup meetings with optional attendance of CLIENT via collaboration tools or in person
Document team capacity (in story points) in Rally
At each stage of planning, document team commitment to completing the user stories via the Rally Iteration and Release Planning functionality
Use Rally tool for documenting discussions, task planning, and metrics
Mark any blocked tasks or user stories using Rally and escalate to CLIENT
Ensure that user story acceptance is requested and completed by CLIENT in Rally prior to completion of the deliverable
Attend CLIENT’s thrice-weekly “Scrum of Scrums” meeting to understand and communicate inter-project dependencies and obstacles
Maintain a documented Definition of Done (DoD) for all work that is equal to or more stringent than the CLIENT’s definition of done documented at https://wiki.scrippsnetworks.com/display/MAM/Definition+of+Done. No user story is considered complete unless it meets the DoD
Retrospectives held and an action plan for improving at least one process must be put in place.
Generate by CI tool plugins code quality metrics reports from every build to continuous integration server
Deployment to CLIENTs Integration (INT) environment, demonstration to stakeholders
Support CLIENT’s Operations team on deployment and validation of deliverables into CLIENT’s QA (staging) environment
Strong proficiencies in MS Visio (or similar software), PowerPoint, Word, Excel and general design and project management disciplines
Experience overseeing and completing projects based around technology and operations (e.g. IT, facilities, corporate services, media ops and broadcast) and with partners (e.g. related operational processes)
Hours of Work per Week :
40 Hrs
5 Days
Salary:
$134,722/Year

Title: Senior Consultant, Analytics
Descriptions:
Company Overview and Culture
EXL (NASDAQ: EXLS) is a global analytics and digital solutions company that partners with clients to improve business outcomes and unlock growth. Bringing together deep domain expertise with robust data, powerful analytics, cloud, and AI, we create agile, scalable solutions and execute complex operations for the world’s leading corporations in industries including insurance, healthcare, banking and financial services, media, and retail, among others. Focused on creating value from data for driving faster decision-making and transforming operating models, EXL was founded on the core values of innovation, collaboration, excellence, integrity and respect. Headquartered in New York, our team is over 40,000 strong, with more than 50 offices spanning six continents. For information, visit www.exlservice.com.

For the past 20 years, EXL has worked as a strategic partner and won awards in its approach to helping its clients solve business challenges such as digital transformation, improving customer experience, streamlining business operations, taking products to market faster, improving corporate finance, building models to become compliant more quickly with new regulations, turning volumes of data into business opportunities, creating new channels for growth and better adapting to change. The business operates within four business units: Insurance, Health, Analytics, and Emerging businesses.

Role and Responsibilities:
Emphasis is on end-to-end delivery of analysis and guiding junior staff
Interact with the client to understand the requirements and communicate / brainstorm solutions
Excellent Communication skills to work with cross- functional stakeholders and lead meetings to understand the requirements for the project and periodically update the client on the progress
Contribute to how analytical approach is structured for specification of analysis
Contribute insights from conclusions of analysis that integrate with initial hypothesis and business objective
Independently address complex problems
Participate in design of analysis and modeling approach with managers and modelers
Extremely comfortable working with data, including managing large number of data sources, analyzing data quality, and pro-actively working with client’s data/ IT teams to resolve issues
Use variety of analytical tools (SQL, Python) and techniques (regression, logistic, GLM, decision trees, machine learning, artificial intelligence etc.) to carry out analysis and drive conclusions
Reformulate highly technical information into concise, understandable terms for presentations
Requirement and Competencies:
Master's or Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Engineering, Math, Statistics, Economics or analytics related field from top-tier universities with strong record of achievement
4+ years of consulting, analytics delivery experience with an entrepreneurial, hands-on approach to work
Very strong analytical skills with the demonstrated ability to research and make decisions based on the day-to-day and complex customer problems required
Hands-on exposure to analytics and visualization tools specially SQL, PowerBI and PySPark
Strong coding experience in Python/PySpark and SQL is a must
Experience working in Agile teams
Prior experience in management consulting and/or analytics based consulting is desirable
EEO/Minorities/Females/Vets/Disabilities

Please be aware that EXL requires all employees to be vaccinated for COVID-19. This position will require the successful candidate to obtain and show proof of a vaccination. EXL is an equal opportunity employer, and will provide reasonable accommodation to those individuals who are unable to be vaccinated consistent with federal, state, and local law.

Base Salary Range Disclaimer: The base salary range represents the low and high end of the EXL base salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to: location and experience. The base salary range listed is just one component of EXL's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include bonuses, as well as a Paid Time Off policy, and many region specific benefits.

Please also note that the data shared through the job application will be stored and processed by EXL in accordance with the EXL Privacy Policy.

Title: Business Analyst (ERP/Finance Interface)
Descriptions:
ONxpress Transportation Partners (ONxpress) were chosen by Metrolinx and Infrastructure Ontario (IO) to enter the Development Phase of the On-Corridor Works project – the largest project in Metrolinx’s GO Expansion. Unprecedented in its scale and complexity, this multi-billion-dollar capital program will transform the GO regional rail network with electrification, more frequent service, shorter journey times and a more modernized system for the Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area.
Accountability
Establishing a system setup specification for the ERP, that enables fast and efficient development, systems integration, and incremental improvements.
Ensuring that the ERP is implemented and configured to meet the requirements of all stakeholders.
collaboration with other entities and stakeholders to ensure seamless interaction and data flows of ERP Data and documents through all relevant IT systems.
cost effective development, testing and systems integration of ERP according to best practices and within defined cost frameworks.
Responsibility
Coordinate and align the ERP Setup according to requirements in the Project Agreement and across the different Legal Entities within ONxpress.
Establish a close relationship with the Business Owners / Heads of HR, Finance, Procurement, Project Management and the Users of the Systems, to translate their requirements into the ERP systems.
Develop, document, plan and prepare ERP business functional specifications.
Manage ERP - plan, organize, control, evaluate and improve the system (implementation, development, operations).
Consult and collaborate with stakeholders across the entire organization and contracting authority to identify and prioritize business and technology requirements for ERP.
Act in alignment with user needs and system functionality to contribute to organizational policy.
Ensure specification integrity and security of data processes within the ERP.
Responsible for the supervision of ERP IT projects.
Implement a strong, collaborative culture and procedures to continuously improve the ERP.
What You Will Bring To The Team
Education
Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field
Experience
2+ years of experience working in IT operations, supervising technology teams, and overseeing large information technology projects, specifically in ERP
Has a record of accomplishment of successfully delivering ERP projects, ideally in the Rail industry
Competencies & Skills
Specialist domain knowledge of Financial, Procurement, Materials / Inventory, Timekeeping, People Management, Project Systems, Portfolio Management, Reports, KPIs, Edge computing
Specialist knowledge of ERPs such as SAP ECC, S4HANA, SuccessFactors, Oracle, – On-Prem and Cloud architectures
Good working knowledge of SAP Information Steward, Data Services, SAP NetWeaver gateway, Cloud Connector, Solution Manager, GRC, RESTAPI, Report Writing / BI, Fiori, Sap Analytics Hub, Power BI
Good working knowledge of IT /OT integrations concepts and current trends and products I.e. ESRI / ArcGIS, Primavera P6, Autodesk, Bently, Aveva / OSIPi, OpenText ECM,
Basic knowledge of Master Data Governance, Document Management and Process Workflow capabilities
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to effectively communicate with teams across the entire organization
Good knowledge of requirements management
High customer benefit orientation
Respectful, appreciative interaction
Experienced in working in intercultural environments and large, complex projects
Fluency in English.
Accommodation:
We value the unique skills and experiences each person brings to ONxpress and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment. We are committed to the requirements of the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act so if you require accommodation during the hiring process, please let our Talent Acquisition Team know by contacting us at recruitment@onxpress.com.

Should you need any accommodation through the recruitment process, please contact recruitment@onxpress.com.
We appreciate your interest; however, only qualified candidates will be contacted by our Talent Acquisition Team. We do not accept unsolicited agencies resumes.

Title: Senior Market Data Analyst - Operations
Descriptions:
Who we are:

FNZ Group is an established and rapidly growing company in the financial technology sector. We partner with the entire industry to make wealth management accessible to more people. Today, we partner with over 650 financial institutions and 8,000 wealth management firms, enabling over 20 million people across all wealth segments to invest in the things they care the most about, on their own terms. We have over 20+ offices globally with 6,000 employees (and growing!).
To learn more about us and our journey, check out
careers site
.
What our Senior Market Data Analysts do:
This Senior Market Data Analyst is a subject matter expert within our Operation Team in Toronto. They are proactive self-starters who work to resolve problems. They have exemplary attention to detail skills and are excellent communicators, especially with their peers, management and external parties. Our Senior Market Data Analyst are team players, as they work seamlessly within our direct team and across the wider global Investment Operations and FNZ family.
Our Senior Market Data Analysts are responsible primarily for the input, maintenance and administration of data and prices relating to all instruments held on the FNZ platforms; and adhering to the key regulatory and process requirements of FNZ.
Other responsibilities for the Senior Market Data Analysts are:
Opening nominee accounts with Fund Managers and any other relevant 3rd parties.
Managing relationships with 3rd parties, including Fund Managers, Brokers, Pricing Vendors, & TPAs.
Liaising with 3rd parties to gather data for all aspects of fund, custody administration (e.g. dealing points, broker charges).
Management of securities and dealing on behalf of FNZ
Updating data to the platform timely and accurately.
Effective management of static data and price feeds to the FNZ Platforms.
Liaise with FNZ clients as and when required for the administration and addition of new funds to the platform.
Introduce improvements to the process.
What we are looking for:
At least 3 years of experience within the Wealth Management, platform, banking or other relevant industry.
Expert knowledge of FNZ technology, systems, processes, and proprietary software.
Thorough understanding of the different types of securities and financial instruments within the North American market.
Have worked with Pricing Vendors, Third Party Administrators or other similar types of Mutual Funds or Equity providers.
Proposition knowledge of platform industry, from Retail Client to Asset Servicing delivery.
The ability to build effective relationships, both within the immediate team and wider business.
Has demonstrated an ability to work under pressure whilst ensuring KPI’s are met.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Understanding of risk/compliance policies and processes for a financial services business
What we offer:
Be part of a highly successful, rapidly growing, global business that is leading the delivery of financial services.
A competitive base salary, bonus, and paid time off.
FNZ will match pension plan contributions at 150%, up to 4% total Employee Contribution.
Employer paid medical, dental and vision insurance, and more.
26 weeks of primary and secondary parental caregiver leave at full salary.
Flexibility in working hours for better work-life balance.
Fulfilling mentor and leadership opportunities.
Working with purpose and making an impact together.
A positive work environment with a sense of purpose to share knowledge and skills amongst other colleagues.
At FNZ, we recognise that diversity, equity and inclusion are important factors contributing to our success. We embrace the unique perspective and capabilities of our current and future employees, which will help us continue to drive innovation and achieve our business goals. Recruitment decisions at FNZ are made in a non-discriminatory manner without regard to gender, ethnicity/race, faith, age, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, socio-economic background, disability or military veteran status where all applicants and employees are valued and respected.
In addition, we want to ensure accessibility needs are well supported, if you require specific support, please advise us.

Title: THE MILLER GROUP | People Analytics Specialist
Descriptions:
Subsidiary: Miller Paving Limited
Location: Markham

Objective
The People Analytics Specialist will be responsible for optimizing the performance of Miller’s HR systems, gathering data, and making recommendations based on performance metrics. They will also lead the designing and improving of HRIS processes by combining their HR knowledge with expertise in HRIS.
Responsibilities
Consult with the larger HR team to determine HRIS needs
Run queries, analyze HRIS performance metrics and resolve application issues by liaising with the Colas Canada HRIS and IT teams
Document processes, identify improvement opportunities and compile HR Reports
Optimize HRIS processes, integrate new software, and perform diagnostic tests.
Provide training and technical support to the HR Team on navigating HRIS modules
Ensure the efficient recording and secure storage of HR metrics, including compensation and employee performance data
Perform regular audits on HR processes and documents, including hiring, termination of service, and payroll administration
Requirements
A bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, HR management, business administration, or similar with 3+ years’ experience as an HRIS coordinator/ analyst
High level of accuracy and strong attention to detail
Ability to collaborate, provide technical support, and train staff
Ability to gather and interpret data, as well as improve HRIS processes
Experience in documenting processes, as well as performing diagnostic tests and audits
Solid understanding of the relationship between HRIS and payroll systems
Advanced excel skills. Experience working with Power BI is an asset
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Miller is proud to provide this unique career opportunity, we offer continuous learning, opportunity for growth, and a competitive compensation package. At our core; we are our people. We succeed because we respect our people and invest in their development, safety and well-being. Miller is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that diversity and inclusion are key attributes to building greatness. Miller’s core values of Integrity and Community welcomes everyone, at work and in the community, and our value of Accountability, means that we own our actions, our decisions and our results. As a Miller employee, this will ultimately be your commitment to our inclusive culture.
We will contact candidates selected for an interview. Accommodation for applications with disabilities will be made during the recruitment process when requested.

Title: Equity Analyst
Descriptions:
We have a lot to be proud of at Nicola Wealth. Our sophisticated financial planning, our diversified private investment funds and their exceptional performance, our 99% client retention rate and our award-winning culture, combine to position us as a national leader in wealth management. Recognized as a Best Managed Company and one of Canada's Top Employers, we are dedicated to upholding our firm's values through this phase of significant growth.
By bringing together smart, dedicated, and supportive colleagues from diverse backgrounds, we deliver extraordinary client service in a values-driven work environment. The collaboration, creativity and entrepreneurial spirit we were founded on provides the opportunity for incoming employees to make a real impact and build a rewarding career. We are passionate about our business, our culture and investing deeply in your growth and development to build the future. If you have this same drive, then let's talk!
Position Summary
We are looking for an Equity Analyst to assist in managing the firm's pooled funds. Are you an engaged self-starter who remains calm under pressure? Do you have excellent analytical skills and the ability to clearly present and share ideas to a number of people in a continually changing environment? In this role you will be generating investment ideas, performing in-depth due diligence on companies across multiple industries while gathering and analyzing information across different sources, building models and evaluating businesses under different scenarios.
The location of this role will be a hybrid work schedule based in our Toronto or Vancouver office.
Key Accountabilities
Generating investment ideas within a collaborative team
Performing in-depth due diligence on companies across multiple industries as a generalist investor
Gathering and analyzing information across different sources
Building company models and evaluating businesses under different scenarios
Building presentations and presenting our findings to our Advisory Services Team, Investment Committee, and clients
Working with other departments within the asset management group to enhance knowledge sharing and investment returns.
Success Factors
You have a professional demeanor with the ability to build trust with our people and partners
You are collaborative and team focused, with the ability to function in a team
You have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
You have well-developed organizational and time management skills
You are calm and collaborative under pressure.
Experience & Qualifications
3-5 years of experience in analyzing Canadian, U.S. and/or International Equities
Bachelor's or master's degree in any discipline
Strong interest in and demonstrated understanding of investment analysis
Financial industry designation completed or in process of achieving (CFA, CIM, CA, CPA etc.)
Advanced proficiency in Excel
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (both written and verbal)
Strong analytical and mathematical ability
Self-motivated and able to work independently
Experience with Bloomberg is an asset
You are legally eligible to work in Canada for any employer.

Thank you for your interest in this position. We are an inclusive equal opportunity employer. For more information about this and other roles: nicolawealth.com/careers.

Title: Data Governance Consultant
Descriptions:
DATA MANAGEMENT CONSULTANT (DATA GOVERNANCE)
Requisition #: R22-2672
Location: Remote
Engagement Type: Contract
Number of Resources required: 1
Rate: Up to $105 per hour / Negotiable
Term: 5 months (January 3, 2023 to May 31, 2023) with two 6-month extensions
Hours per day: 7.25
Submit to Tri-global: December 11, 2022 (on or before 12:00 PM Mountain Time)
Closing Date: December 12, 2022 (10:00 AM Mountain Time)
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Tri-global Solutions Group Inc. is seeking one (1) Data Management Consultant (Data Strategy / Data Governance) to join our team at Service Alberta to support the Data Strategy and Data Governance roadmap within the Government of Alberta.
The successful contractor(s) have an anticipated January 3, 2023 start date for an initial 5-month contract (ending May 31, 2023) with two 6-month extensions available (total contract term up to 17-months).
NOTES ON LOCATION: Resource will work remotely, though must be available for onsite meetings if required. Standard Hours of work are 08:15 - 16:30 Alberta time. Work must be done from within Canada, due to network and data security policies.
Please review the project overview and requirements below. If you meet the requirements and are interested in submitting for this role, please reply to this job posting.
If you know other consultants who may be interested in this opportunity kindly share this job posting.
Thank you.
Warm regards,
Jesse Smith
Tri-global Solutions Group Inc.
Melton Building - 3rd Floor
300, 10310 Jasper Avenue NW
Edmonton, AB T5J 2W4
------------------------------------------------------------------------
PROJECT OVERVIEW
Service Alberta (Data Unit) has recently developed the GoA Data Strategy.
The strategy requires evolving and resources to support this effort.
The resource will be required to:
Sets policy, standards and priorities to govern the delivery of the Data Strategy. Resolves escalated decisions or issues, and provides stakeholder support to Data Secretariat, as needed.
Collaborate with the Data Team, as well as with others in the division and across GoA to identify and analyze potential data governance solutions;
Prepare briefing notes, meeting minutes, and other documents;
Draft detailed Governance documents to expand the Data Strategy and Data Governance Framework;
Prepare presentations for engagement with stakeholders, steering committees, project groups and other stakeholders;
Collect and compile information about department-level data governance and connect it key foundational elements of enterprise data governance;
Align the data governance components to the Data Strategy and Data Governance Framework throughout development and stakeholder engagements;
Manage tasks and action items and follow up and escalate as required;
Provide support by collecting and compiling information from external stakeholders, departments, and Service Alberta teams;
Coordinate approvals and sign-offs; and
Maintain engagement, meeting, and opportunity trackers.
DESCRIPTION OF SERVICES
Can span activities related to information management and technology strategic planning, project definition, program communication, providing leadership to project teams, facilitating strategic partnerships with external stakeholders, conducting business process reengineering activities and facilitating executive discussions on strategic matters.
Works with Senior and Executive Management in the Ministry to:
Identify and advance information management and technology strategies that advance and/or support our core business in strategic areas.
Facilitate collaboration of public sector, private industry, and other partners to identify and advance opportunities to improve existing services and/or identify, develop and advance opportunities for new and innovative information management and technology related services.
Facilitate and manage the challenges associated with innovation and change.
MANDATORY SKILLS
- Proposed resource must meet or exceed one of the following: (6+ years)
University graduation in Finance, Business, Science, Public Administration or a related discipline and 2-yr related experience;
OR
2-yr diploma in Business, Science, Public Administration, Law or a related discipline and 4-yr related experience.
OR
1-yr certificate in Business, Science, Public Administration, Law or a related discipline and 5-yr related experience.
OR
6-yr related experience
- Experience in the Data Governance discipline, including in governance in relation to data sharing, de-identification, metadata, data quality, ethics, synthetic data, data literacy, data linkage and data integration (5+ years)
- Experience with either establishing and/or leading governance forums to resolve escalated decisions/issues for stakeholders (5+ years)
- Experience in leading large-scale projects/initiatives (projects which span across jurisdictions/departments, multiple areas) (5+ years)
- Experience providing consultation and support to clients at all levels of an organization (5+ years)
- Experience in the development and implementation of data economy standards, processes, and mechanisms to enable the ministry to manage information through its entire lifecycle (5+ years)
- Resource must have own computer equipment and be comfortable using it for completion of work required by this contract
- Proposed resource must work from within Canada, due to network and data security issues. Standard Hours of work are 08:15 - 16:30 Alberta time.
DESIRABLE / NICE TO HAVE SKILLS
- DAMA Certified Data Management Professional (CDMP)
- Data Governance and Stewardship Professional (DGSP)
- Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) certification
- PMI Project Management Professional (PMP) certification
- Experience with either establishing and/or leading governance forums to resolve escalated decisions/issues for stakeholders (5+ years)
- Experience with data privacy concepts (de-identification, legislation, ethics, etc.) (5+ years)
- Experience with data management tools (e.g., data governance tools, BI, analytics, big data, data visualization, etc.) (5+ years)
WHY WORK WITH TRI-GLOBAL?
This role allows you to grow your professional work experience and skills in a dynamic environment. Tri-global is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: Up to $105.00 per hour
Benefits:
Work from home
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Education:
Bachelor's Degree (preferred)
Experience:
Extensive Data Governance: 5 years (required)
leading & providing consultation and support to clients: 5 years (required)
data privacy concepts: 1 year (preferred)
data management tools (data governance tools, BI, analytics): 5 years (preferred)
leading large-scale projects/initiatives: 5 years (required)
leading governance forums to resolve escalated issues: 5 years (required)
development and implementation of data economy standards: 5 years (required)
Licence/Certification:
Data Governance and Stewardship Professional (DGSP) (preferred)
DAMA Certified Data Management Professional (CDMP) (preferred)
Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) (preferred)
PMI Project Management Professional (PMP) certification (preferred)
Work Location: Remote
Expected start date: 2023-01-03

Title: Business System Analyst
Descriptions:
Requisition ID: 175198

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

We are looking for a Business System Analyst to join our IBT Risk Retail team to help us find the best solutions for the Risk Systems Portfolio for Scotiabank in Chile, Perú, Mexico, Caribbean, Costa Rica, Panama and Uruguay. This is an exciting opportunity to start with us on a challenging journey migrating one of the most important Risk applications (OMDM) to a new version in AWS, Decision Modeler.

As a Business System Analyst, you will participate in all aspects of the software delivery life cycle (SDLC), except development, of one of the most important Risk Platforms worldwide, OMDM-Decision Modeler. You will analyze business and user needs, documenting requirements and translating them into proper systems requirement specifications, and the assessment of the risk and quality of changes and enhancements to the mentioned system. You will not only get the opportunity to grow and learn from experts, but also to lead and control some phases of our projects to enhance your leadership and project management skills.

If you are an experienced software engineer with a strong analysis, quality and project management-focused mindset, keen interest in cutting-edge applications, and thrive in a fast-moving environment - this is the position for you!

What will you do?
Participate in almost all aspects of a SDLC (Requirements, Analysis, Design, Test, Production deployment and support).
Independently resolve complex, multi-faceted problems to meet the business needs of the Retail and PYME Risk Areas of Scotiabank, particularly in Chile, Peru, Costa Rica, Panama and Uruguay.
Rapid prototyping, with requirements and solutions developed on an iterative basis that provides interim deliverables until a final production solution is created.
Manage multiple small projects and/or lead specific sections of large projects to implement solutions to business problems.
Work collectively within a dynamic team to actively participate and lead configurations and support of Risk Systems solutions deployment in accordance with designs.
Work with Scotiabank infrastructure teams to maintain and support infrastructure and services under management
Lead root cause analysis to in-scope systems, identify improvements, and drive to implementation.
Develop operational plans, processes, and procedures to improve service delivery and resiliency
Support production issues and handle escalations during the day as well as off-hours.

What do you need to succeed?
You’ve been a business system analyst in a large product team and seen how different components of a complex architecture come together to deliver a product.
You are passionate about analyzing, testing, and delivering highly available, reliable, and scalable enterprise systems.
You are proficient in leading small projects, since the requirements phase to production support.
You have in-depth knowledge of project management techniques and are proficient in their use.
You have experience in Unit Testing, such as familiarity with SOAP UI and Postman.
You are an excellent communicator, planner and visioner, able to influence decision making across stakeholders.
You have competency to lead team members with differing opinions and levels of experience.
You can map and execute short- and long-term plans for the team.
You love what you do but you are seeking a more challenging environment.
You are fluent in verbal and written communications in English and Spanish.

What's in it for you?
We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity and curiosity and celebrates success
We provide you with the tools and technology needed to create meaningful customer experiences
You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world
We hire you for your talent — not just a job — so you can grow with us. We’ll equip you for success not only in your role, but also in your career as a whole
Access to thousands of online and in-person courses so you can hone your current skills, or learn new ones
A competitive rewards package that includes a base salary, a performance bonus, company matching programs on pension and share ownership, paid vacation, personal & sick days, medical, vision, mental health, parenting and dental benefits and much more.
Onsite subsidized café station, workplace ecosystem based where you will find the best spot for your work activities.

Work conditions: Hybrid/Remote
Some of our perks & onsite offerings will be offline as we continue to monitor federal and provincial regulations around COVID-19

#LI-Hybrid

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Analyste BI junior | Junior Business Intelligence Analyst
Descriptions:
Rejoignez Delmar et démarrer une carrière passionnante!

Mandat:
Relevant du Responsable ERP et Analytics, vous ferez partie d'une équipe dynamique, responsable du développement, du maintien et de l'amélioration de divers rapports et tableaux de bord, en utilisant Power BI. L'analyste Power BI devra faire preuve d'un sens aigu d'analyse, de créativité et de souci du détail et de l'apparence, ainsi que de bonnes connaissances en développement BI dans le souci des échéances.
Ce dont nous avons besoin :
Nous recherchons un analyste Power BI pour se joindre à notre dynamique et enthousiaste équipe BI. Relevant du Responsable ERP et Analytics, vous prendrez part à des projets excitant reliés au développement, maintien et amélioration de divers rapports et tableaux de bord, en utilisant Power BI.
Etes vous :
Doué d'un fort esprit d'analyse, créatif et soucieux du détail
Capable d'esprit critique et solutionneur de problèmes avec une bonne compréhension de stratégies de développement BI

Vos fonctions quotidiennes incluent mais ne sont pas limitées à :
Analyse du besoin client (internes), transformation et mises en récit des données à l'aide de mesures et KPIs efficaces et pertinents (data storytelling)
Développement et déploiement de rapports et tableaux de bord créatifs, dans le souci de l'apparence et du détail et suivant les meilleures pratiques du design graphique
Développement et maintenance de stratégies de déploiement au sein de la plateforme Power BI pour faciliter l'usage et la navigation des rapports à l'échelle globale
Support aux développeurs seniors dans les tâches de développement de modèles de données (analyse, tests unitaires, documentation, etc.) ainsi qu'aux usagers de la plateforme pour la diffusion des rapports et la formation continue

1 à 3 ans d'expérience en analyse de données, développement de rapports d'intelligence d'affaire
Connaissances et expérience dans la prise du besoin client, et dans le prototypage de solutions innovantes
Expérience dans la conception de rapports efficaces et pertinents (portfolio un atout)
Expérience en UI/UX et développement
Expérience avec Power BI (Power Query, DAX, Power BI Service) recommandée. Les expériences avec d'autres outils similaires sont considérées un atout (Qlik, Tableau)
Bilingue, à l'aise en anglais et comprenant le français
Ce que nous offrons:

Des projets stimulants et l'acquisition de connaissances variées
Rémunération concurrentiel
Un équilibre entre le travail et la vie familiale avec travail à distance selon règle établie

Get started on an exciting career at Delmar!
Mandate:
Reporting to the ERP and Analytics Manager, you will be part of a dynamic team responsible for the development, maintenance and improvement of various reports and dashboards, using Power BI. The Power BI Analyst will need to demonstrate strong analytical skills, creativity, with attention to detail and design, as well as a good understanding of BI development in a timely manner.

We are looking for a Power BI Analyst to join our dynamic and enthusiast BI Team at Delmar. Reporting to the ERP and Analytics Manager, you will be part of exciting projects focusing on development, maintenance and improvement of various reports and dashboards, using Power BI.

Strong in analytics, creative with a keen eye for detail?
Critical thinker, problem solver and understanding of BI development strategies?

Development and deployment of creative reports and dashboards with attention to design and keen eye for detail, using graphic design best practices and Delmar branding guidelines

Support for senior developers in data modeling development tasks (analysis, unit testing, documentation, etc.) as well as for end-users for report deployment and continuing education

1-3 years' experience in data analytics, developing business intelligence reports
Knowledge and experience in gathering customer requirements and prototyping innovative solutions
Experience in designing effective and relevant reports (portfolio an asset)
UI/UX experience and development
Experience with Power BI (Power Query, DAX, Power BI Service) recommended. Experience with other similar tools considered an asset (Qlik, Tableau)
Bilingual, fluent in English and understanding French

Excellent interpersonal skills
Well organized and able to work both as a team and individually according to established priorities and deadlines
What we offer:
A dynamic and enthusiast team
Exciting projects and various skill development
Competitive compensation
Balance between work and home life with work from home according to policies in place

Title: Sustainable Investment Associate
Descriptions:
Job Description
Who We Are:
At Fidelity, we’ve been helping Canadian investors build better financial futures for over 35 years. We offer individuals and institutions a range of trusted investment portfolios and services - and we’re constantly seeking to find new and better ways to help our clients. As a privately owned company, we boldly embrace innovation in all areas as we continue to grow our business into the future.
Working with us means you’ll be part of a diverse and dedicated group of people who make a real difference for our clients and communities every day. You’ll have a wide range of opportunities to grow and develop your career in an inclusive environment where you’ll feel valued and supported to be your best - both personally and professionally.
Role Overview:
The Sustainable Investment Associate is responsible for supporting and promoting Fidelity Canada’s ESG investment products and initiatives. Reporting to Director, Product Innovation, the Sustainable Investment Associate will support ESG investing initiatives including the development and management of new and existing ESG products, collaborating with sustainable investing/ESG-related investment organizations, and maintaining current knowledge of regulatory changes that may impact ESG reporting and disclosure, in order to drive Fidelity’s sustainable investing marketing and sales efforts.
What You Will Be Doing:
Product Stewardship
Build, maintain and communicate at an expert level of knowledge on assigned sustainable investment products
Ensure that assigned products deliver on their stated investment objective and strategies
Maintain accurate product positioning on the dimensions of portfolio manager style, process, product attributes, characteristics, and ESG ratings and metrics
Product Development
Conduct competitive research and product reviews to analyze industry ESG trends and identify key factors that will drive sales success
Demonstrate a high level of product, market, and competitive investment category expertise
Bring new products and solution to market by collaborating with external resources and internal partners throughout Fidelity
Sales and Marketing Support
Collaborate with marketing, sales and other internal partners in the development of all promotional materials for new and existing sustainable investing products and solutions
Ensure that Fidelity’s sustainable investing products and solutions are supported with strong baseline collateral that clearly and accurately reflects the investment merits of each offering
Assist RFP teams in response to ESG-related queries received from external sources and institutional clients
ESG-related organization and regulatory monitoring
Collaborate with external ESG organizations to promote alignment with organizational goals and initiative
Develop an understanding of ESG reporting frameworks and regulatory changes that would be relevant to Fidelity’s policies and procedures and engage with internal stakeholders on these topics
What We Are Looking For:
Completion of a University degree or equivalent work experience
1 to 3 years of prior experience in an analyst or analyst-equivalent position within product (investment) management and/or product research & development
Interest and/or experience in sustainable investing/ESG investment products is nice to have
Understanding of PRI reporting requirements and general awareness of sustainable investing/ESG-related organization is an asset
The Expertise You Bring:
Strong understanding of sustainable/ESG investing philosophy and principles
Strong knowledge of investment products and services
Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
Excellent presentation, oral and written communication skills
Ability to build and maintain relationship with all levels of internal and external business partners
Ability to adapt quickly and easily to a changing work environment
Current work authorization for Canada is required for all openings.
Fidelity Canada is an equal opportunity employer
Fidelity Canada is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We will consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national or ethnic origin, age, disability, family status, protected veterans’ status, Aboriginal/Native American status or any other legally-protected ground.
Accommodation during the application process
Fidelity Canada welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in the selection process. If you require an accommodation, please email us at
FidelityCanadaStaffing@fidelity.ca
.
No telephone inquiries or agencies please. We thank all applicants for their interest, please be advised that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Why Work at Fidelity?
We are proud to be recipients of the following:
Awards
Canada's Top Family-Friendly Employers 2023 (7th consecutive year)
Canada's Top 100 Employers 2023 (7th consecutive year)
Greater Toronto's Top Employers 2023 (10th consecutive year)
Canada's Top Employers for Young People 2023
Venngo Healthy Workplaces Award Workplace Benefits Awards – Health and Wellness Program
HRDC Best Places to Work 2022
Designations
A Canadian Compassionate Company
Great Place to Work (Dec 2022 - Nov 2023)
Best Workplaces for Women 2023 by Great Place to Work

Title: Data Scientist - Algorithms
Descriptions:
Would you like to shape our strategy for Data?

Are you passionate about Data and Analytics technologies?

Join our Data team!

Process & Pipeline Services (PPS) supports the full lifecycle of customers' asset from pre-commissioning to decommissioning. We help to reduce corrosion, improve efficiency and maximize throughput. Our solutions for pre-commissioning, commissioning, and maintenance shutdowns include specialized services for oil and gas, power generation, metals and mining, and other process industries.

Partner with the best

As a Data Scientist, you will focus on commercially-facing development projects, typically involving large, complex data sets. This typically includes statisticians, computer scientists, software developers, engineers, product managers, and end users, working in concert with partners in Baker Hughes business units.

As a Data Scientist, you will be responsible for:
Developing analytics within well-defined projects to address customer needs and opportunities
Designing, developing and delivering new algorithms and software for analysis and reporting of pipeline inspection data
Working alongside software developers and software engineers to translate algorithms into commercially viable products and services
Delivering technical support, including algorithm and software maintenance, to multi-discipline teams across Baker Hughes' world-wide operational bases
Collaborating with other engineering disciplines, domain experts, internal and external customers
Contributing to continuous improvement and quality initiatives as well as innovative approaches and solutions to business problems

Fuel your passion

To be successful in this role you will:
Have completed a B.Sc, M.Sc, Phd. in Software Engineering, Mathematics or other relevant discipline such as data science/intelligent systems/machine learning
Have numerical skills used in a data science context, including working with numerical data in analytics and/or machine learning contexts
Demonstrate skills and experience in algorithm development from design, prototyping, and testing, to delivery and application to engineering problems
Have software development experience in Python, C++ or Java working in a production environment across the full software lifecycle
Be able to show excellent problem-solving, process improvement and analytical skills
Have excellent communication and presentation skills.
Demonstrate awareness of how to leverage curiosity and creativity to initiative business impact

Work in a way that works for you

We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:
Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive

Working with us

Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.

Working for you

Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:
Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities
Comprehensive private medical care options
Safety net of life insurance and disability programs
Tailored financial programs
Additional elected or voluntary benefits
About Us:
We are an energy technology company that provides solutions to energy and industrial customers worldwide. Built on a century of experience and conducting business in over 120 countries, our innovative technologies and services are taking energy forward – making it safer, cleaner and more efficient for people and the planet.

Join Us:
Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let’s come together and take energy forward.

Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Title: AI-Driven Algo-Trading Strategy Research Scientist
Descriptions:
You, as AI-Driven Algo-Trading Strategy Research Scientist, of Eon Labs Ltd. (”EonLabs”), will be solely and independently responsible for using your existing AI-driven trading bots for cryptocurrency futures contracts (e.g. ETHUSDTPERP) to trade Binance managed sub-account and to generate excess return for it.
Hey there, curious algo-trading wizards!
Are you ready to flex your brain muscles and advance your earnings through our industry status, prop funds, and connections to institutional funds? Then check out our latest recruitment post at https://bit.ly/feature_engineer. Make sure to take a look at the "Evaluation" page. It's like the Jedi trials of algo-trading, where we'll determine if you have what it takes to become one of our algo-ninjas. So don't be shy, and give it a look. It'll give you a better idea of the kind of backtesting performance that'll make us say, "Wow, this person is the real deal!"
(Please note that the message above is meant to ease your stress while you're advancing your career in finance and should not be taken as a joke.)
EonLabs is a distributed company that has a workforce policy of flexplace and flextime. If you join us as an employee, although you are not required to work specific hours, you have to use Jira and TimeDoctor to track your work progress and time spent, especially if you’re a Canadian resident so that we can use the log as a proof to claim the Scientific Research and Experimental Development (SR&ED) investment tax credit (ITC). Weekly company group meeting is held on Monday. You'll also have weekly one-on-one meetings with the CEO.

For more, read: https://bit.ly/feature_engineer
〄 Compensation
Read https://bit.ly/feature_engineer
〄 The Company - Eon Labs Ltd.
a fully remote company from the start
privately owned, no involvement from venture capital
5 full-time permanent employees + 2 probationary employees
trade proprietary & qualified client funds
top 10 performer on on CryptoFundResearch among 800+ reporting funds
AUM >$20 million in USD
Link in Bio: https://bit.ly/m/eonlabs
〄〄 Company Traction, Highlights
2017, Started trading crypto perpetual futures contracts based on models built by machine learning algorithms with founders’ own money
2020, Formed investment club in Vancouver, BC, Canada to handle money from friends and family
2021, Ranked 48th in overall profit in the market space of Binance Coin-M Futures
2022, Helped client (i.e. Axon Enigma GP) reached 7562.49% return since inception (~29 months) as verified by Swiss auditor BDO Global
〄〄 Overall Vision (long term 5+ years)
Mission. To enhance the investment lives of those who trust our technology by helping qualified partners and their client investors reach their financial management goals.
Vision. The current assets under management (AUM) is approximately $20 million in USD. We aim to reach $150 million USD and beyond by 2025.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent, Casual

Benefits:
Flexible schedule
Schedule:
Monday to Friday

Commission pay

Book(s), paper(s), project(s) and/or site(s) that you'd recommend for algo-trading.

algo-trading with backtesting results: 3 years (required)
Work Location: Remote

Title: Analyst Business Analysis & Reporting
Descriptions:
Joining Suncor means you will work for one of the best companies in Canada, providing tremendous future potential where talented people thrive and lead. As our business evolves, so do our employment opportunities. Our work culture includes a dynamic mix of professionals, with a diversity of skills and expertise.
Do you have strong reporting and analytical skills combined with the ability to summarize data and extract a concise message? Are you looking for an exciting opportunity to put your strong financial and analytical skills to use?
You’ll be a trusted advisor to our Oil Sands operations team and will provide key support preparing monthly financial results for our Upgrading business.
Minimum Requirements:
A Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, or economics
Eight years of relevant oil and gas experience
A recognized accounting designation (CA, CPA, CMA, CGA) with a solid understanding of financial and accounting principles
Strong computer skills, including proficiency with SAP/BW, SAP analytics cloud program and Microsoft Suite of tools
Strong interpersonal skills with proven success in business partnering outside of finance team
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a strong attention to detail
The ability to translate data into concise key messages either for presentation or discussion purposes for non-finance audience with a continuous improvement mindset

Responsibilities:
Deliver stewardship reporting, forecasting, business planning cycles and accounting policy decisions
Collaborate with business partners regarding all aspects of financial and business performance
Engage with budget owners and supply chain management to drive effective cost performance
Synthesize large amounts of detailed information quickly and present to stakeholders
Provide information to our central consolidation and reporting team

Location and other Key Details:
You will work out of our Calgary head office, located in the Suncor Energy Centre at 150 –6th Ave S.W.
Hours of work are a regular 40-hour work week, Monday to Friday
Our business professional roles follow internal compensation guidelines and the pay band will generally be based years of experience and scope of work
Depending on the nature of the role, we have implemented a Hybrid Work Model to provide our employees with a combination of office-based work and ‘work from home’ flexibility.
#LI-Hybrid
Why Suncor?

Suncor's operations include oil sands development, production and upgrading; offshore oil and gas; petroleum refining in Canada and the U.S.; and the company's Petro-Canada retail and wholesale distribution networks (including Canada's Electric Highway™, a coast-to-coast network of fast-charging electric vehicle stations). Suncor is developing petroleum resources while advancing the transition to a low-emissions future through investment in power, renewable fuels and hydrogen.
With a strong strategy for growth and our long-standing approach to sustainability, operational excellence, capital discipline and technology and innovation, Suncor offers a solid foundation for you to continue building your career. We offer rewarding opportunities for you to learn, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions – all of which means tremendous potential for your future. We are focused on deepening our commitment to inclusion and diversity and creating a respectful workplace.
We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected. We have numerous employee inclusion networks to help foster an inclusive and respectful culture and drive positive change within Suncor. Current networks include both workplace inclusion networks (focusing on inclusion and respect for all), and identity-focused networks (focusing on building community and a sense of belonging and allyship). Through the Journey of Reconciliation, we are progressing the way we think and act to build greater mutual trust and respect with the Indigenous Peoples in Canada. Please note we will consider accessibility accommodations to applicants upon request.

Partner with the best

Be detailed, analytical, process orientated approach with ability to drive issues to a robust closure in a timely manner

Title: Climate Scientist, Financial Applications
Descriptions:
The Role: Climate Scientist, Financial Applications

Grade ( relevant for internal applicants only ): 11

The Location: US - Virtual

The Team: The Climate Center of Excellence is part of S&P Global’s Sustainable1 (S1), the centralized source for essential sustainability intelligence at S&P Global. This position is on the Science team within the Center of Excellence. The Science team provides state-of-the-art science to power S&P Global products and help the world’s financial institutions, companies, and governments measure and manage the financial risk from climate change. The Science team is a group of experienced climate scientists who conduct cutting-edge applied research on the physical and economic impacts of climate change. The science team works on forward-looking projects that anticipate emerging needs in climate risk analysis.

The Impact: The mission of the Center of Excellence is to embed climate information into global decision making. We believe this will accelerate a sustainable and equitable transition to a low carbon economy and help make the world more resilient to the most important challenge of our time. Meeting this immense challenge requires coupling advanced physical science with advanced economic and financial modeling.

What’s in it for you: The successful applicant will have the opportunity to join a dedicated group of leading scientists working in a rapidly growing field to address some of the world’s most pressing challenges. Sustainable1 is growing rapidly, and there will be commensurate growth in professional development opportunities. The successful applicant will be exposed to new modeling and data methods that will be widely applicable in future projects.

Responsibilities:
Work with the science team to develop and test innovative ways to model the financial impacts of climate-related physical and transition risk on financial institutions and non-financial corporates.
Develop methods to apply the outputs of physical and economic models to quantitative financial decision-making and risk management for S&P Global customers.
Evaluate and extend the types of physical and economic data needed to support climate-relevant financial decisions
Contribute to technical reports and academic publications.
Keep pace with evolving technical literature in areas to our modeling.
Work with the customer product teams to keep them abreast of both advances and limitations in our modeling techniques.
Present research externally to our customers and at technical conferences

Basic Qualifications:
Experience in quantitative modeling and analysis of how climate-related risks and opportunities affect financial decision-making and risk management. Solid understanding of the uses of climate risk data in financial decision making, and decision-relevant metrics.
Master’s or PhD relevant to financial impacts of climate change.
High standards for data integrity and meticulous attention to detail and consistency.
Well organized and able to manage projects independently with deadlines.
Good communicator and able to work successfully in a team environment.

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with climate-related financial models and data relevant to this area.
Experience in financial risk analysis
Strong interest in inter-disciplinary approach to physical, social, and economic impacts of climate change.
Experience with data analysis in R, Python, or another appropriate language/package.
Experience in statistical and probabilistic analysis of large data sets.
Familiarity with Unix-based and AWS computing environments.

Compensation/Benefits Information (US Applicants Only): S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $83,200-$154,400 . Base salary ranges may vary by geographic location.
In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive plan. This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits, we provide to our employees, visit https://www.spgbenefitessentials.com/newhires .

About S&P Global Sustainable1: S&P Global Sustainable1 is the central source for sustainability intelligence from S&P Global. Sustainable1 matches customers with the ESG products insights and solutions from across S&P Global divisions to help meet their unique needs. Our comprehensive coverage across global markets combined with in-depth ESG intelligence provides financial institutions, corporations and governments an unmatched level of clarity and confidence to successfully navigate the transition to a sustainable future. Our data and well-informed point of view on critical topics like energy transition, climate resilience, positive impact and sustainable finance allow us to go deep on the details that define the big picture so customers can make decisions with conviction. To learn more about Sustainable1, visit www.spglobal.com/sustainable1 .

Personal development, S&P sponsor our employees to spend time building their skills and knowledge on areas that are of personal interest and that can be beneficial to the business over the long term. We want our people to develop and stay for a long time. Examples include training in consultative selling techniques, external qualifications, and certifications in topics such as ESG as the market evolves, all the way through to MBA’s.

The Workplace, we would like to encourage you to apply if you thrive in an environment that supports flexible working, we have adapted to a hybrid model and will continue this path in the future with the ability to work remotely and within the offices that we have throughout the United States.

Employee Resource Groups, developing a diverse workforce is one way we ensure our collective success. We support eight Employee Resource Groups dedicated to engaging and empowering diverse groups at S&P Global. You can find more information here: https://www.spglobal.com/en/who-we-are/diversity-equity-inclusion/people-resource-groups/

-----------------------------------------------------------

Equal Opportunity Employer
S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Title: Service Technician IV
Descriptions:
Overview
Solenis is a leading global producer of specialty chemicals, focused on delivering sustainable solutions for water-intensive industries, including the pulp, packaging paper and board, tissue and towel, oil and gas, petroleum refining, chemical processing, mining, biorefining, power, municipal, and pool and spa markets. The company’s product portfolio includes a broad array of water treatment chemistries, process aids and functional additives, as well as state-of-the-art monitoring and control systems. These technologies are used by customers to improve operational efficiencies, enhance product quality, protect plant assets, minimize environmental impact and maintain healthy water. Headquartered in Wilmington, Delaware, the company has 47 manufacturing facilities strategically located around the globe and employs a team of over 6,000 professionals in 120 countries across five continents. Solenis is a 2022 US Best Managed Company.
For additional information about Solenis, please visit www.solenis.com or follow us on social media.
Description
A service technician will be a part of a team that will focus on maintaining an assigned account, or group of accounts. This position focuses on ensuring our chemical feed equipment is properly working and our products are transferred in a safe manner. Safety and communication are the highest priorities in this job. It’s important to discuss all daily, or weekly, tasks with you engineer/sales team.
Major Responsibilities
Specs out, sets up, maintains, and troubleshoots monitoring and feed equipment
Manages product inventory at the customer site, transfers product when needed, & responsible for uploading new order requests
Adjusts chemical feed levels to meet optimal chemical performance based on routine testing and monitoring
Alerts the sales manager of potential problems or opportunities and creates customer interface to resolve issues
Minor interface levels with the customer to understand any issues and report back to Solenis team
Conducts expanded testing of process variables to identify dosage improvements or mechanical impacts
Has strong knowledge around spare parts for Solenis equipment and orders replacement parts when needed
Maintains an organized equipment area and follows customer’s housekeeping guidelines
Safety Training- Responsible for completing and maintaining safety courses for Solenis, as well as customer sites
Mentor other technicians in the area and lead cross-training opportunities
Qualifications
High School Diploma or GED equivalent
